meanings.definition: A collection or gathering of things or people.
meanings.sent1: The assemblage of colorful flowers brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an impressive assemblage of ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The assemblage of toys in the playroom made the children squeal with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry box was an assemblage of precious gems, each with its own story.
meanings.sent5: The assemblage of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The act of assembling or putting together.
meanings.sent1: The quick assemblage of ingredients resulted in a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The workers completed the assemblage of the new furniture in record time.
meanings.sent3: His assemblage of excuses for being late was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: The assemblage of words in the poem painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The assemblage of gears in the clock made it tick with precision.
